docs.lead_paragraph: ECONOMIC DATA SINKS STOCKS The stock market plunged late in the afternoon, registering its biggest drop in three weeks as investors were hit by fresh worries over declining consumer confidence, falling house prices, shrinking profits on Wall Street and uncertainty about the Federal Reserve. MEDIAN INCOME EDGES UP The nation's median household income grew modestly in 2006, even as the percentage of people without health insurance hit a high, the Census Bureau reported. [A1.]
